Henry Handy was a happy, healthy, six-year-old boy, who was playing out in the back yard of his house, when he spotted something soaring towards the ground as it came falling out of the sky. As Henry looked up, he saw a small ball of fire heading right towards him, at tremendous speed!

"What's that?" he wondered, as the ball of fire landed in the woods behind his house with a loud bang.

Henry quickly got up and opened the wooden gate to the back yard, and walked outside. He was just tall enough to reach the latch on the gate, and he used both hands to push the door open, so he could go outside.

Henry knew he wasn't supposed to go outside, but his curiosity just had the best of him.

As he walked into the woods, he spotted a odd, glowing object at a distance. As he came closer, he saw a small, blue rock, letting off a strange, blue light.

Henry was only wearing his sandals and his shorts, since it was very hot outside. He had been playing with his plastic truck and his small tricycle, pedaling around the back yard, when the meteor landed behind his house.

As Henry approached the odd rock, the glow intensified. Then, when Henry got within six feet of the rock, a bold of bright light shot out of the center of the rock, striking Henry in the chest!

Henry immediately fell to the ground and passed out, laying close to the rock, as it continued to shower the boy with its odd, blue ray. A minute later, the rock's energy had depleted, and all of its alien power had transferred to the unconscious boy. The rock no longer glowed, and it turned to gray.

Moments later, Henry woke up, to an odd feeling in his body. His muscles felt stiff and hard. He slowly got up, feeling dazed, and started walking back to his house. While walking back, Henry realized that he was getting heavier. His arms began to grow thicker; his shoulders widened a few inches; his chest stuck out further; his thighs were thicker and wider; and his calves were big and round and hard.

Henry stepped through the back door of the house and walked into the bathroom. He gasped, when he saw his reflection! He looked like a little gymnast! His shoulders were wider than before and his arms were really thick! He had abdominals now and his chest was sticking out by six inches. He had transformed into a little muscle boy!

"What... What the heck?" he wondered, as he studied his physique in the mirror. He had changed, but in a way, he felt GREAT! He was STRONG! Very, VERY strong!

Just then, his mother walked into the room...

"Henry... Uhh... Why did I call you that..." his mom said. She shook her head and blinked for a moment when she saw him standing there. "Herc... Uhh... Hercules, can you lift the car so I can change the tire?"

Henry stared at her with a quizzical look on his face.

"Mom? Hercules?"

"Sure, Hercules! What's the matter? We always called you that! Ever since you were born, because you've always been so strong!" his mother replied.

"You... you want me to... lift the car?" Henry gulped.

"Oh, Herc! You've lifted things far heavier than that! What's the matter with you? Are you feeling alright?" his mother asked angrily.

"S-sure, mom! I'm fine! I've never felt better! I feel strong!" Henry replied.

"Good! Now, lift my car so I can get that flat tire off, will you?"

"Sure, mom..." Henry - now Hercules - said, as he walked to teh garage, where his mom's sedan was parked...

When he got there he took a moment to look himself over in the mirror. He was average height for his age, about 4'5'', with medium length blond hair in a style like slightly shorter skater hair, and blue eyes. He had a fairly athletic body, and he was a pretty athletic boy so it made sense. He made an effort to do parkour, and it was a serious effort to work his entire body, and the results showed, his pecs showed a little, and he could flex a good four pack and biceps, and he had to admit he was proud of all of it.

But he also didn't want to let his pride get the best of him, so he kept it up, just to keep his body in top shape. He'd remembered reading about the Greeks and how they trained their body and mind because they believed each benefited the other. And he believed that too. So he worked out both. "Isaac!" his mother called "Hurry up in there!"

'I guess I have to work on my punctuality,' he thought sheepishly as he turned the shower on. He quickly stripped, got showered, and got out. He dried off and wrapped a towel around his waist as he made his way back to his room where he put on fresh boxers, blue and white athletic shorts, and a white and blue sleeveless shirt. Then he dashed downstairs, rushing right by his older brother, Jacob who was twelve. "Jeeze Issac, slow down," he heard his brother said.

"Sorry Jake!" he called. "Hey mom."

"Good morning dear," his mom said.

Isaac's mom was in decent shape for her age, partly from trying to keep up with him and her hair was dirty blond. "You're going to the skatepark in a little bit right?"

"Yup! I'm meeting my friends there, we'll come back here later for cake and stuff."

So he did as he said he would. About an hour and a half later he was on his way to the skatepark where he met his friends. They mostly just hung out, skateboarded and talked. They tried to best each other's tricks. It was during Isaac's own attempt at one that the first significant event of the day occurred.

He was on his board and barreling down the half-pipe, then up the other side and into the air. Then, just as he was about to perform his trick he felt like something had pierced his body, causing him to go completely numb and lose consciousness. As a result he fell onto the ramp hard and slid down.

"It is his tenth birthday, the very day he shall receive the Powers of the Angel," a male voice replied.

"If that is Its will, than we cannot deny it," the woman replied, "But to burden one so young."

"Do not underestimate human children. They have such great potential and are much stronger than we think."

"Yes, you're rii... Isaac? Isaac!?"

Isaac sat up straight, hearing one of his friend's voices. "Woah! I'm okay! I'm fine," he said to the crowd that had gathered around.

"Dude, you had us worried," one of his friends, Matt, said.

"Yeah, that was a bad fall," Carson, another friend, added.

"So dude, you down to keep chillin' here or do you want to go home and rest?" Matt asked.

Isaac was thinking of the weird dream he'd had while unconscious, so it took him a moment to address Matt's question. "Well..."

She continued to laugh for a minute before she stopped and looked at him.
"Good one, but I know as well as anyone that doesn't happen to people. So," She said, her face becoming serious. "what really happened?" Paul (the doctor) sighed and looked at her sternly before continuing.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
You awoke to a black room with no memory whatsoever. You thought and thought and for a scary second you couldn't remember your own name. And yet, after a moment, it came to you.
"Dan." You said, which seemed to prompt a swift flow of memories. You remembered everything, from leaving your homework to getting hit by a car by a loose memory of being carried then put into an ambulance. You looked around expecting to see a hospital room or maybe, if you were lucky you would see your bedroom with the lights still out.
But instead, you saw nothing. Before anything else, you assumed you may be blind, then that there may be something in front of your eyes. These ideas were instantly demolished as you saw a small light come into focus, and the floor, a rocky black substance that seemed to reflect light came into view. You took a step forward, then another, though why you didn't quite know. You eventually stopped in front of what seemed to be a large alter, and waited, wondering why you were there. You still were wondering when a person began to take shape on the alter. You gazed in both awe and fear as a person, or more specifically a middle aged man in rags that were probably once nice clothes, appeared on the alter. He stood taller than he should, about seven feet tall, with ragged black hair that reached his shoulders and deep, thoughtful brown eyes. You gazed for a minute after he finished materializing and, deciding you should speak, asked your first question.
"Where are we?" The man seemed to notice you for the first time as you spoke up, and he seemed to consider the question for a moment before responding.
"We are in your mind." He said in a deep, ominous voice that was giving the feeling of confidence.
"In my mind?"
"Yes."
"But it doesn't look anything like I think it should." But even as the words left your mouth you realized that it was just like you expected.
"Ah, but aren't you thinking "A dead place for a dead person." ?" You stared in surprise as he seemed to read your mind, and he just smiled a dark smile.
"I was hit by a car, shouldn't I be dead?"
"No," He responded, getting a serious face immediately. "you are alive because I changed you. People of your world are beginning to doubt the powers they don't understand, so I am fixing it. I am changing you and others in your world and giving them abilities. If you search the worldwide news, you will find that there were many other accidents at the exact same time as yours. The others will survive as well, and so I explain and leave you a choice." The man explained, gazing down at you and making you feel weak and insignificant by comparison.
"Explain what?" You asked nervously.
"You see, each of you has been given a power of some kind or another. What I wish to explain are the basics of your powers, and what they may do. Yours is the most unorthodox and at the same time potent power of all those I have given. Yours is the power of evolution itself."
"Evolution?"
"Yes, evolution. Your ability will be both your blessing and your curse. With it, you may imagine almost any change and enter a metamorphic state. By doing this, you can change small things about yourself, from eye color to breathing underwater. Yours is also vulnerable for a few reasons. For one, in the metamorphic state, the slightest wandering of thoughts can change the result of the transformation. Another is that the more drastic the change, the longer you must stay in the cocoon you grow when changing." The word cocoon made you gasp and your eyes felt like they were bugging out of your head. Before he continued, you could swear that there was a flicker of a smile on the man's face.
"Yes, you enter a cocoon for a time. If anything breaks through the fairly flimsy cocoon, you will be completely unprotected until either you grow a new cocoon, or the evolution finishes. Luckily for you, for anything but the most drastic of changes, you will only remain in the cocoon for a few minutes. Also, of all the abilities given, yours is the most easily noticed. What this implies is that it will be hard to hide the changes that occur on your body. If I may make a recommendation, perhaps it would be wise to make yourself a powerful creature early on and change only slightly when needed."
"What if I don't want to do this and become a freak?" You asked, earning you a very serious glare from the man.
"Then I will remove the power and your body will cave in from the injuries." You frowned, liking this option even less.
"Alright," You said, giving in. "How do I enter the state of...um...metamorphosis you called it?"
"You simply lay down, relax, and imagine the change happening. Also, in the metamorphic state, time will seem to go extremely quickly."
You sighed, not liking this one bit.
"Three more questions." You said firmly. "One, how can I tell where there are others like me with your "Blessings" ?"
"They will seem to radiate energy, but be warned, you do the same, and they can use this to find you."
"Two, how do I get out of my head?"
"Simple, you are currently in your first metamorphic state. Any after this, time will just seem to go quickly, but this time I brought the two of us into your mind to speak. Imagine the changes you want, and wait."
"Third, what-" You began, before being interrupted.
"What am I?" You nodded, again amazed by his power. "I am no god, since that is what you're thinking. I am a spirit with great power from long ago."
The man then faded away, the words "That was three." echoing in the air itself for a full ten seconds after he disappeared. Dan sighed and concentrated on what he should be like.

1133111.content:
You sighed and concentrated on what you might want changed. Obviously, you wanted to keep as close to normal as possible, but at the same time give yourself a few perks. You started with the most obvious ones and worked up. Water breathing, increased strength, a bit taller, faster would be useful, fire breath, thermal vision, and the ability to stick to walls at will. Thinking more deeply, you decided to think how each power would work. Small gills on the base of your neck for water breathing, but as small as possible while still able to breath and skin color of course. A tiny bit more muscle on the arms and legs for strength and speed. Slight change on leg length, though you would have to think deeply on fire breath. Thermal vision was obviously allowing your mind to switch between the normal vision apparent in most creatures and a slightly more rare ability to detect heat. The ability to stick to walls was a challenge, but you eventually remembered something on TV about the gecko and it's special method of sticking. So, you decided to set it up so that you could pull the tiny hairs used to get the "molecular contact" or whatever it was that geckos used to stick to walls on and off the face of your hands and tips of your feet. After a bit of thought, you decided that it would work for some food and drink (especially flammable foods and drinks) to be sent semi-instinctively to a second stomach, or fire stomach as you dubbed it. By semi-instinctively you were thinking like breathing, where you can stop but otherwise it automatically happens. Anyway, in the fire stomach, it would be converted into a flammable gaseous mixture whereupon it could be released at will from the compressed second stomach and ignited by a flame produced partway up the throat. For good measure, you decided to make your hands just slightly more thick for normal climbing and swinging, to avoid tiring your hands and to keep from getting callused.
After finishing your thoughts, you thought of returning to the waking world. After a few moments thought, you awoke to a hospital room and just for a second, you could imagine it was all a dream, and that you were recovering from the crash at a normal hospital. It all seemed possible imagining the dream you had. You stayed laying down for a few minutes and relaxed, when your dreams were shattered.
You felt a thin layer pull off of your body, something small at the base of your neck on each side fold in, a small change in your neck, the feeling of hundreds, if not thousands of hairs fold into your hands and a certain part of your feet, and a feeling of strength in your arms and legs. At the same time you saw a thin dark layer fold off of your body and seemingly into your skin, and you saw the world quickly flash from normal to a colored view you assumed was thermal vision, back to normal. You sighed and were about to get up when you heard a door open and heard a voice.
"Daniel?" Not only was the voice familiar, but the owner of the voice said your full name, and the only person who used that was...
"Hi mom." You said, sitting up and looking into her deep, blue eyes that were nothing like your brown eyes. She stood 5'4", or 5'7" if you counted the high heels she was wearing. She was about 50 by your estimate and looked younger, though she was beginning to show signs of age. She looked at you for just a moment before beginning to get teary and rushed forward to hug you.
"Daniel, you're alright! I was so worried about you, especially when the doctor made up that lie about you being in a cocoon."
"Really, I feel fine." You stood, and found you were taller as well. Normally, your mom was just taller while wearing her high heels. But now, you seemed to have gained at least five inches, and were now taller than her. She looked at you, seeming to notice this as well.
"Wow, you grew so fast! How long was I missing the growth spurts?"
"I don't know." You said, deciding to change the subject.
"Are we going home?"
"As soon as you're ready, we can go." She responded. By this time the doctor seemed to have regained his speech and curtly disagreed.
"No, you should stay. I know what I saw and I need to know what happened." You ignored him, but at the same time your mom seemed to be outraged.
"Why, you're still insisting upon that stupid, idiotic idea that he grew a cocoon?! Leave us alone or I'll force you aside!" You were slightly shocked by this, since your mom rarely did anything rash like that.
"Come on, let's go." She said, spinning angrily on her heels.

"Deal."

"Idiot!" he yelled out loud. And it was the truth. Why did he constantly get himself into these situations? Why didn't he just ignore the party instead of trying to force himself in. Why didn't he have the sense to leave the carton of eggs at home instead of looking for trouble. He could be in his dorm room safely finishing his ten page paper for English 115. But, no. He burst onto the roof of the building. Where now? Where the hell was he going from here? Late autumn rain was pouring down from the black sky. No stars, just flashes of lightning and rolling peals of thunder. Tiny raindrops and hail stones pelted his face as he searched desperately for a fire escape or some way down.

The door burst open again. Hugo dove behind a rusty air conditioning unit. The frat guys were pissed off, now. Not only had some freshman punk showed up at their party without an invitation, the little prick had started throwing eggs at people. The leader wiped the last strings of yolk off his face. He told his boys to spread out and find the kid so that he could personally kill him.

Hugo tried to make a break for the door, but one of the guys, probably a linebacker, tackled him from behind. Hugo was instantly flattened to the ground. He thought he felt the cell phone in his pocket snap in half, but it could've been a bone. The leader stormed over and grabbed Hugo by the hair, pulling his head off the ground. He glared at Hugo.

"Nobody...does that to one of my parties...and gets away with it," he yelled over the thunder. It was getting closer now, and the storm was getting worse. One of the frat guys jumped when another clap of thunder shook the old dormitory building to its foundation. Hugo took the opportunity to spit at the leader. The wind blew it back in his face. Always the little hothead, he chastised himself.

The linebacker pulled Hugo up and held him so the leader could take a few swings at him before letting his muscle do the dirty work. Before he had a chance, Hugo elbowed the linebacker in the side. He was released and ran for the door back into the building, but another guy blocked his path. They were converging on him, determined not to let their prey escape.

Hugo jumped up on top of one of the old air conditioning units, which was slick with rain water and hail. The frat guys rushed to climb up and drag him down, but before they got within a few feet of it, there was a flash of light, accompanied by an ear-piercing blast. Time seemed to slow to a crawl. Hugo could feel the electricity frying his brain, spreading down his spinal cord, causing his arms and legs to spasm and writhe. He could see flashes of light erupt from his finger tips and streams of blinding electricity pouring out his feet into the a/c unit. He could feel the rain on his face boil off. He could feel his feet lift off the ground. He could hear distant screaming, probably his own. And then, there was nothing...

Hugo groaned. He felt as if his whole body was on fire, inside and out. Light came streaming into his eyes. There were blurred shapes around him. Slowly - too slowly - they shifted into focus. There was an IV bag hanging above his head, dripping steadily into a clear tube that ran all the way down to his arm.

"Hey," a soft voice, said. Hugo rolled his head over to the other side of the hospital bed. A young woman, about his age, was sitting next to him, holding his hand. Dark brown hair fell in curls around her face. Her pale face was beautiful and kind. Her eyes were sharp and intelligent, but they were red from hours of crying. She frowned and did her best to keep from weeping as she spoke. "Don't you ever do that to me again."

Hugo just stared at her, studying her face for several second before he remembered who she was and why she was here. Rachel - the only girl he had ever known who could put up with him. He remembered her, now. He wasn't quite sure why he was in a hospital, though.

"Rachel," he said. It hurt to speak. His neck had been badly burned and moving any of the muscles in his head was painful. "Rachel, what happened?"

She tried to stem the flow of tears. "Oh, baby...the doctors...they say you were struck by lightning." Lightning? What were the odds of that? How on earth had he been struck by lightning? Suddenly, she looked angry again. "What the hell were you doing on that roof last night?"

Why had he been on the roof? Wasn't there a party there? No, the party was downstairs. He had gone in, armed to the teeth with eggs and water balloons... Then, he remembered the fight, the escape, being cornered on the roof.

"Well, I was...I went to that party," he started. "And, well, I wasn't too popular there. So, I had to make a hasty get away...and I ended up on the roof..."

She hit him in the arm. He cringed. He was sore all over. "You idiot! Goddammit, Hugo! When will you ever learn to think before you do something stupid?" She got up and stormed out.

"Rachel! Wait!" he called after her. His neck hurt and his shoulder, and most of his face, but he didn't want her to blame him for this. She had threatened to break up with him if he didn't learn to keep his cool. He didn't want to lose her. He couldn't. "Wait!"

He stopped. Something here was out of place. The remote to call the nurse with was hovering an inch off the bed. Just hanging in space. Then, it dropped to the ground. He held his hand over it again, but it didn't move. Instead, a Get Well card on the table next to the bed inexplicably slid off the table, hung in the air for a second and then clattered to the floor.

Hugo looked at his hands. They were unharmed, unblemished by the searing lightning bolt. He wasn't a believer in telekinesis, but this was hard to explain away. What on earth was going on?

I became the champion every under-sized kid needed but that got me more my share of fights. I was always coming home dirty, and sweaty which is what I tried so hard not to be.

I hit six feet on my sixteenth birthday and stopped growing upward. I looked the same way, then, that I do, now. I came home one day with a black eye and weariness in every line of my body. I was sweaty, and dirty, as usual.

Here we have Ashley Legenzie, 23 years old, from a first glance, she's fairly normal, fiery red hair, decent curves (C-cup for those interested, but she always secretly wanted to be a bit curvier), and bright green eyes. However, she is not at all normal, she is one of the 'Supers' that dot the planet, some in organized groups akin to the Avengers, Justice League, or Super Acquaintances, some run solo. Ashley here has the powers of super strength, durability, and flight.

Just one, little problem....she has to be (functionally) naked to really use her powers. Her supersuit is nothing but her mask and cape (which is actually more akin to Shazams cape than supermans).

During her early years, she was thoroughly embarrassed by her power set, and tried to just be normal, but it was impossible, she always caved and rushed to help whoever was in need. The press and moral guardians were always hounding her, no matter how much she tried to explain her situation to them, they'd never listened.

So she ignored them.

At least she wasn't alone, the Streak, a French speedster from LA was in the same boat, and he often was a source of friendly advice and comfort whenever she needed it.

But she'd established herself here in Florida, and accidentally got sponsored by a nudist club, but at least she was he own woman. Who was she?

The Crimson Wonder.
